docTitle.titlePart:
REVIEW OF CROSSTALK BETWEEN BEAM-BEAM INTERACTION
AND LATTICE NONLINEARITY IN + − COLLIDERS *

byline.docAuthor:
Y. Zhang †
, IHEP, Beijing, China; D. Zhou, KEK, Ibaraki, Japan

front.div:
Abstract
According to the conventional knowledge, it is believed
that the nonlinearity in the arc would not reduce the beam-
beam performance, since the beam-beam force is dominated
in the beam core region while the lattice nonlinearity is dom-
inated in the beam halo region. However in the recent few
+ − storage ring colliders, it has been shown that the lat-
tice nonlinearity may be important to the luminosity perfor-
mance. In this paper, we'll try to review the related story
in DAFNE, and its upgrade with crab waist scheme, KEKB,
Super-KEKB and BEPCII.
